title: New Mills
name: Stroll through Torrs Riverside Park
content: One possible route is to descend from Torr Top car park (just off Market Street), passing '''Torr Top Cottages''', a listed range of weaver's cottages [http://www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk/en-81897-torr-top-cottages-new-mills-derbyshire], walk downstream along the '''River Sett''' to its confluence with the '''River Goyt''' (site of the '''Torrs Hydro''' reverse Archimedes screw[http://www.torrshydro.org/]). Take the right-hand fork to cross the '''Millennium Walkway''' and view the Grade II* listed '''[http://www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk/en-469219-torr-vale-mill-attached-weir-sluice-gate Torr Vale Mill]''' before returning to the town centre via Station Road. Total distance approx. 1 mile, with one steep descent and ascent but otherwise level.
